page.title: 18W.Ashby farmers wife cont.
page.content: for the fires.5 to 6p.m. evening meal and listen to the news on the radio. ( the radio was a great blessing in remote districts,also a source of interest and entertainment). Wash up and then wash and pack the eggs. 7.30 p.m. onwards - family mending, rug making or some knitting. 9.30 p.m. a hot drink and so to bed. Some farmers' wives had live-in domestic help, some had help two or three days per week. Farmers wives too in those days coped with pig killing-curing hams,sides of bacon and making pork pies,hasletts and sausages.
